flawed_nl_solution:
The school bought 10 x 20 = <<10*20=200>>200 bottled water.
There were 200 - 70 = <<200-70=110>>110 bottled water left after the first game.
So, there were 110 - 20 = <<110-20=90>>90 bottled water used during the second game.
#### 90

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 130, not 110. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
